citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A female, mixed breed dog identified with USDA tag #20 was observed to have a large amount of dried and thick, sticky
discharge on and around both eyes. The licensee stated that the dog's eyes have been this way for approximately six
weeks and that he has been treating them with a spray used for pink eye. The medication is not listed as a treatment for
eyes in the Program of Veterinary Care and the Attending Veterinarian (AV) has not evaluated the dog's eyes. Large
amounts of discharge in and around the eyes is abnormal and can be a symptom of serious and painful health conditions.
Using an unapproved medication in the eyes, without the guidance of the AV, may do nothing to correct the underlying
condition and may worsen the problem. The dog's eyes must be evaluated by the AV and the prescribed treatment must
be followed. Correct by September 26, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A female, mixed breed dog identified with USDA tag #20 was observed to have a large amount of dried and thick, sticky 
discharge on and around both eyes. The licensee stated that the dog's eyes have been this way for approximately six 
weeks and that he has been treating them with a spray used for pink eye. The medication is not listed as a treatment for 
eyes in the Program of Veterinary Care and the Attending Veterinarian (AV) has not evaluated the dog's eyes. Large 
amounts of discharge in and around the eyes is abnormal and can be a symptom of serious and painful health conditions. 
Using an unapproved medication in the eyes, without the guidance of the AV, may do nothing to correct the underlying 
condition and may worsen the problem. The dog's eyes must be evaluated by the AV and the prescribed treatment must 
be followed. Correct by September 26, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
